JUDGES: Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Volodymyr Butkevych;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving his sentence in the GPE , ORG no . CARDINAL of GPE .
The applicant was apprehended on DATE and held in detention on suspicion of being involved in murder and theft of private property .
In DATE the investigator remitted the case - file to ORG , which on DATE remitted the case for additional investigation to the ORG prosecutor .

On DATE the ORG , in the presence of the applicant and his representative , following examination of a wide range of documentary and oral evidence , sentenced the applicant to life imprisonment and confiscation of all of his personal property following his conviction for murder and theft of private property committed as a member of an organised criminal group .

On DATE ORG , sitting in a chamber composed of CARDINAL judges and in the presence of the applicant and his CARDINAL representatives , rejected the cassation appeals lodged against the judgment of DATE as they were unsubstantiated . It confirmed the applicant ’s conviction , having examined a wide range of documentary and oral evidence .
On DATE , DATE and DATE ORG refused to re - examine the applicant ’s case in the course of extraordinary review proceedings , finding no grounds for it .

Following the applicant ’s conviction , in DATE , he unsuccessfully complained to ORG and ORG , various other state institutions , about the unlawfulness of his conviction and various procedural irregularities that from his point of view occurred in the course of examination of his case .

According to a letter of DATE from ORG , on DATE the applicant requested ORG , which was examining his criminal case , to allow him to marry ORG However , this request was not examined and no answer was given to the applicant as on DATE ORG remitted the case for additional investigation and the applicant did not repeat his request for permission to marry ORG The letter also stated that the applicant ’s passport had remained with the prosecutor ’s office throughout the proceedings , including the period when the case - file had been remitted for additional investigation , and after the applicant ’s conviction became final it was sent to the court for enforcement of the sentence imposed on the applicant .

In DATE the applicant requested ORG to provide him with his passport so that he could marry . On DATE ORG replied that his passport was at the court of appeal and thus he had to address his request to that court .

On DATE the ORG of Appeal informed the applicant that his request lodged with the court on DATE to allow him to marry ORG had not been examined by that court because the case had been remitted for additional investigation to the prosecutor ’s office . Thus , he should have addressed the prosecutor office as it was from then on responsible for processing his criminal case . Also , when the case arrived at the court in DATE he had not requested anew permission to marry .

On DATE ORG informed the applicant that his passport was part of his personal file and had been archived at the penitentiary institution where he was serving his sentence . They also informed him that it was being exchanged for a new NORP ordinary citizen ’s passport ( in exchange for the invalid NORP passport he had ) .
On DATE the applicant received an internal NORP passport in exchange for the NORP passport issued to him in DATE .

On DATE the applicant requested ORG to inform him about the procedure for registration of marriages . On DATE the applicant received detailed explanations as to how registration of marriages for convicts could be effectuated .

In accordance with LAW , convicted persons had the same rights and duties as other citizens of GPE , with restrictions provided by the law , resulting from the judgments of the court and the regime of serving their sentence , as provided by these judgments .

Marriages are registered in accordance with the general rules of ORG CARDINAL – CARDINAL of the Code on Marriage and Family . According to LAW the presence of the couple is obligatory for registration of marriages . However , if a person is unable to attend registration of marriage at the civil acts registration department , marriage can be registered at other LOC . LAW established a limited list of circumstances that would preclude a person from getting married , however , conviction of a person or his detention were not seen as an obstacle for registration of a marriage .

By virtue of Rule CARDINAL - CARDINAL.CARDINAL registration of marriage with convicts shall be conducted on the general grounds referred to in the Code on Marriage and Family . A marriage can be registered on the basis of a request from a person who is not serving the sentence as well as a convict himself . The completed documents are then sent to the penitentiary for transfer to the convict ( Rule CARDINAL ) , who is to fill out his part of the application for marriage and after that the documents and the convict ’s signature are certified and sent to the appropriate civil acts registration department ( Rule CARDINAL ) .

If a convict is the person who initiates the marriage , then he requests the relevant documents from the penitentiary ( including a special application form ) , fill them out and send them to the person he intends to marry , who shall then also fill them out . The completed documents are then transferred to the civil acts registration department ( Rules CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .

The persons concerned are then informed ( the respective penitentiary institution shall inform the convict ) by the civil acts registration department of the date and time of the marriage ( Rule CARDINAL ) . The registration of marriage takes place in the LOC designated by the penitentiary institution ( Rule CARDINAL ) . The relevant remarks as to registration of marriage are put into the ordinary national passport of the married couple ( Rule CARDINAL ) . Registration of marriage for persons who are detained pending trial is conducted by the relevant civil acts registration departments at ORG ( GPE or prisons ) , only upon written permission of the body , which is responsible for the case , in accordance with the procedure and rules established for the penitentiary institutions .
